section.title: Demonstration 1 Main Page

content.text: This demonstration covers the simplest fixed asset referencing example. It shows a construction purchase order (PN) referencing one asset record for the full amount of the purchase order. Thus, one asset record with one accounting line is referenced by the purchase order. It demonstrates the following key concepts: How to reference real property fixed asset from a purchase order How to search for a fixed asset
Demonstration 1 | Purchase Order with One Header Accounting Line to One Asset Record
Pegasys Fixed Assets

content.text: We will begin on the Header page for the Order (PN)
Click on the Fixed Assets tab

section.related-content: Click to add notes for the selected slide

content.text: The Fixed Assets page appears
Click the Add button
Click the Asset Number link to search for an Asset Number
The Search - Asset Query page appears
Click the Search button
Since Real Property Asset Numbers begin with the Project Code, I'll enter the project code followed by an asterisk.
Click the Select button to choose the Asset Number
The Asset Number and Asset Type are filled in automatically.
Enter the Betterment Number. It is 0 for the original asset.

section.related-content: Click to add notes for the selected slide

content.text: Click on the Accounting Lines tab
The Accounting Lines page appears
Click the Add button to add an Asset Accounting Line.
The Asset Accounting Line is used to determine how much of each Header Accounting Line will be associated with the asset.
The Accounting Line Number should reference a Header Accounting Line. There is only one Header Accounting Line on this order, so we'll enter 1 here.
The Header Accounting Line has $100,000 on it, and we want to put the entire amount on this Asset
Click the Save button
Then click the Verify button.
If there are no errors, click the Submit button
